Yes, there are several events and festivals in the Caucasus region where traditional costumes are showcased. Here are a few examples:

In Georgia, one of the best-known festivals is the Tbilisi Open Air Folklore Festival, which takes place in July each year. This festival features musicians, dancers, and craftspeople from all over Georgia, as well as traditional costume displays and other cultural events.

In Armenia, the Yerevan Wine Days festival, which takes place in October, includes a traditional costume parade featuring dancers, musicians, and other performers dressed in traditional garments.

In Azerbaijan, a popular event is the Novruz Bayrami celebration, which takes place in March and is centered around the traditional Azerbaijani holiday of the same name. The festival includes music, dance, and a parade featuring traditional costumes.

These are just a few examples, and there are many other events and festivals throughout the region where traditional costumes are showcased. I would recommend researching specific events and festivals in each country to find out more information.
